recipes.title: Peanut Sauce
recipes.attribution: Mrs. Pat Groen
recipes.description: Indonesian-style peanut sauce perfect for satay, grilled meats, and rice.

ingredients.prep_note: use less if using regular soy sauce

instructions.text: Place all ingredients in a small saucepan. Stir over gentle heat until mixed.
Heat only until hot, letting the sauce boil will cause the oil in the peanut butter to separate. A little more water may be added for desired consistency.
Serve over Saté, grilled meats, and or rice.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for hot pepper paste or Tabasco
Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Strawberry Butter
recipes.description: Sweet strawberry butter for bread and muffins.

instructions.text: Blend all ingredients together until smooth.

flags: Instructions incomplete - recipe continued on next page

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Fruit Sauce
recipes.description: Sweeten to taste with 1 to 2 tablespoons sugar. Serve over ice cream, cake, cheesecake, or crepes.

ingredients.prep_note: apricot halves, cherries, fruit cocktail, peach slices, pear slices, pineapple, raspberries, strawberries

instructions.text: In a saucepan mix orange peel, orange juice, cornstarch, and cinnamon. Stir in undrained fruit.
Cook and stir till bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more. Serve over ice cream, cake, cheesecake, or crepes.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 4-cup measure mix orange peel and juice, cornstarch, and cinnamon. Stir in undrained fruit. Micro-cook, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 3 to 5 minutes or till bubbly; stir every minute till slightly thickened, then every 30 seconds. Cook 30 seconds more.

missing_inputs: Not in database: canned or frozen fruit

recipes.title: Orange Sauce
recipes.description: Tastes great with gingerbread or ice cream.

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine sugar, cornstarch, and orange peel. Stir in orange juice. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Cook and stir 2 minutes more. Remove from heat; stir in margarine or butter. Serve warm.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 2-cup measure mix sugar, cornstarch, and orange peel. Stir in orange juice. Micro-cook, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 2 to 3 minutes or till bubbly; stir once. Stir in margarine. Serve warm.
Lemon Sauce: Prepare as above, except substitute lemon peel for the orange peel and 1/2 cup water plus 1 tablespoon lemon juice for the orange juice. Makes 2/3 cup (4 servings).

recipes.title: Caramel Sauce
recipes.description: Rich caramel sauce for ice cream, fruit, cheesecake, or cake.

instructions.text: In a heavy saucepan mix sugar and cornstarch. Stir in 1/4 cup water. Stir in cream and corn syrup.
Cook and stir till bubbly (mixture may appear curdled). Cook and stir for 2 minutes more.
Remove from heat; stir in margarine and vanilla. Serve warm or cool over ice cream, fruit, cheesecake, or cake.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 2-cup measure mix sugar and cornstarch. Stir in 1/4 cup water, then cream and corn syrup. Micro-cook, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 2 to 3 minutes or till bubbly, stirring every minute till slightly thickened, then every 30 seconds. Stir in margarine and vanilla. Serve as above.

recipes.title: Hot Fudge Sauce
recipes.description: Rich chocolate sauce for ice cream. To reheat 1/2 cup in your microwave oven, allow 15 to 30 seconds on high power.

instructions.text: In a heavy small saucepan melt chocolate pieces and margarine or butter. Add the sugar; gradually stir in milk.
Bring to boiling, reduce heat. Boil gently over low heat for 8 minutes, stirring frequently.
Remove from heat. Serve warm over ice cream.

notes: Peanut-Butter Fudge Sauce: Prepare as above, except, after cooking 8 minutes, stir in 1/4 cup peanut butter. Then remove from heat.

recipes.title: Rhubarb Sauce
recipes.description: Sweet-tart rhubarb sauce for cake or ice cream.

instructions.text: In a saucepan mix sugar, water, and, if desired, orange peel strip. Bring to boiling.
Add rhubarb slices. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 5 minutes or till rhubarb is tender.
Remove peel. Serve over cake or ice cream.

recipes.title: Vanilla Sauce
recipes.description: Delicious with fresh or poached fruit.

instructions.text: In a small saucepan combine yolks, milk, and sugar. Cook and stir till mixture is thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat. Cool, then chill.
To serve, whip cream and vanilla to soft peaks. Fold into yolk mixture.

recipes.title: Whiskey Sauce
recipes.description: Southerners traditionally ladle this sauce over bread pudding.

instructions.text: In a small saucepan melt margarine or butter. Stir in sugar, egg yolk, and water.
Cook and stir constantly over medium-low heat for 5 to 6 minutes or till sugar dissolves and mixture boils.
Remove from heat and stir in bourbon. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Hard Sauce
recipes.description: Traditionally served with steamed puddings and warm gingerbread.

instructions.text: In a small mixer bowl beat together softened margarine or butter and powdered sugar with an electric mixer on medium speed for 3 to 5 minutes or till mixture is well combined.
Beat in vanilla. Spoon into serving bowl. Chill to harden.
Serve with plum pudding or warm gingerbread.

notes: Brandy Hard Sauce: Prepare as above, except substitute 1 tablespoon brandy or rum for the vanilla.
Orange Hard Sauce: Prepare as above, except substitute 1/4 teaspoon finely shredded orange peel and 1 tablespoon orange juice or orange liqueur for the vanilla.

recipes.title: Herbed Sauce for Fish
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 167
recipes.description: A quick herbed butter sauce to brush over fish during baking or broiling.

ingredients.item: dried dillweed, basil, rosemary, or oregano

instructions.text: In a small saucepan melt margarine or butter.
Stir in lemon juice, dried herb of choice (crushed), and pepper.
Brush over fish during baking or broiling (see fish cooking chart, page 185).

notes: Marked as FAST in cookbook
Choose your herb based on the fish: dillweed pairs well with salmon, basil with white fish, rosemary with heartier fish

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 167)

recipes.title: Fast Fish Fix-Ups (Quick Sauces)
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 177
recipes.description: Three quick sauces to dress up baked fish fillets, fish portions, or fish sticks.

ingredients.item: Note: Choose one of the three sauce recipes below

instructions.text: DILLY-BUTTER SAUCE: Melt 1/4 cup margarine or butter in a saucepan. Stir in 1 tablespoon flour and 1/4 teaspoon dried dillweed. Add 3/4 cup milk. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in one 2-1/2 oz jar shredded process Swiss cheese. Makes 1 cup.
TEX-MEX SAUCE: Cook one 8-oz can tomato sauce, one 4-oz can diced green chili peppers, 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander, a pinch of sugar, and 1/4 teaspoon bottled hot pepper sauce till heated through.
SWEET-SOUR SAUCE: Cook one 10-oz can pineapple tidbits, one 8-oz jar sweet-sour sauce, and half of a green or sweet red pepper (cut into strips) till heated through.

notes: Marked as FAST in cookbook
For a delicious dinner in a hurry, put frozen breaded fish portions or fish sticks in the oven and top with one of these easy sauces

missing_inputs: Not in database: Note: Choose one of the three sauce recipes below

recipes.title: Peanut Sauce
recipes.attribution: Mrs. Pat Groen

ingredients.item: garlic powder or grated garlic toes

ingredients.prep_note: use less if using soy sauce

instructions.text: Place all ingredients in a small saucepan. Stir over gentle heat until mixed. Heat only until hot, letting the sauce boil will cause the oil in the peanut butter to separate. A little more water may be added for desired consistency. Serve over Sate, grilled meats, and or rice.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for hot pepper paste or Tabasco
Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Pesto for Pasta
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 269
recipes.description: Fresh basil pesto sauce perfect for tossing with hot pasta.

instructions.text: In a blender container or food processor bowl combine basil, Parmesan or Romano cheese, nuts, oil, and garlic. Cover and blend or process till the mixture is nearly smooth, stopping machine occasionally to scrape down sides.

Divide pesto into 4 portions. Serve 1 portion at a time over 4 ounces hot cooked pasta. (For remaining pesto, place each portion in an airtight container and chill for 1 to 2 days. Or, freeze for up to 1 month.)

notes: Spinach Pesto for Pasta: Prepare as above, except use 1/2 cup torn fresh spinach and 1/2 cup firmly packed fresh basil leaves instead of 1 cup basil.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 269)

recipes.title: Cream Gravy
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The perfect crowning touch for fried poultry.

instructions.text: After frying poultry, transfer poultry to a platter; keep warm. Reserve 2 tablespoons of the drippings in the skillet (discard remaining drippings).

Stir in flour, bouillon granules, and pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir over medium heat till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 1 minute more. If necessary, thin with a little additional milk. Makes 1 3/4 cups (6 or 7 servings).

recipes.title: Pan Gravy
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic pan gravy made from roast poultry drippings.

instructions.text: After transferring roast poultry to a serving platter, pour pan drippings into a large measuring cup. Also scrape the browned bits into the cup.

Skim and reserve fat from drippings. Place 1/4 cup of the fat in a medium saucepan (discard remaining fat). Stir in flour. Add enough broth or water to remaining drippings in the measuring cup to equal 2 cups. Add all at once to flour mixture.
Cook and stir over medium heat till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Makes 2 cups (8 to 10 servings).

recipes.title: Giblet Gravy
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Rich gravy with chopped giblets for extra flavor.

ingredients.item: turkey or chicken giblets and neck
pan drippings from roast turkey or chicken

instructions.text: Rinse giblets and neck. Refrigerate liver till needed. In a medium saucepan combine remaining giblets, neck, celery, onion, and lightly salted water to cover. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 1 hour or till tender. Add liver; simmer 20 to 30 minutes more for turkey (5 to 10 minutes more for chicken) or till tender.
Remove and finely chop giblets. Discard neck bones. Strain broth. Discard vegetables. Chill chopped giblets and broth till needed.
After transferring roast turkey or chicken to a platter, pour pan drippings into a large measuring cup. Skim and reserve fat from pan drippings.

Pour 1/4 cup of the fat into the saucepan (discard remaining fat). Stir in flour, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Add reserved broth to the drippings to measure 1 1/2 cups. Add broth mixture all at once to flour mixture. Cook and stir till bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Stir in giblets. If desired, chop egg and stir in. Heat through. Makes 2 cups (8 to 10 servings).

recipes.title: White Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Basic white sauce - the foundation for many variations.

instructions.text: In a small saucepan melt margarine or butter. Stir in flour, salt, and pepper. Add milk all at once.
Cook and stir over medium heat till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Makes 3/4 cup (twelve 1-tablespoon servings).

notes: Microwave directions available
Variations: Low-Calorie, Almond, Cheese, Curry, Herb-Garlic, Lemon-Chive, Mexicali, Parmesan, Sherry

recipes.title: Hollandaise Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: A classic creamy sauce with a rich lemon flavor.

instructions.text: Cut margarine or butter into thirds and bring it to room temperature.

In the top of a double boiler combine egg yolks, water, lemon juice, pepper, and dash salt. Add one piece of the margarine or butter. Place over boiling water (upper pan should not touch water). Cook, stirring rapidly, till margarine melts and sauce begins to thicken.

Add the remaining margarine or butter, a piece at a time, stirring constantly. Cook and stir till sauce thickens (1 to 2 minutes). Immediately remove from heat. If sauce is too thick or curdles, immediately beat in 1 to 2 tablespoons hot tap water.
Serve the sauce with cooked vegetables, poultry, fish, or eggs. Makes about 3/4 cup (twelve 1-tablespoon servings).

notes: Microwave directions available

recipes.title: Béarnaise Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic French sauce with tarragon - perfect for steak.

ingredients.item: snipped fresh tarragon or 1/4 teaspoon dried tarragon, crushed
snipped fresh chervil or pinch dried chervil, crushed

instructions.text: Cut margarine into thirds and bring it to room temperature. In a small saucepan combine vinegar, onion, tarragon, chervil, and pepper. Bring to boiling; boil 2 minutes on high or till reduced by about half.

In the top of a double boiler combine yolks, 1 tablespoon water, and vinegar mixture. Add one piece of the margarine. Place over boiling water (upper pan should not touch water). Cook, stirring rapidly, till margarine melts and sauce begins to thicken.

Add remaining margarine, a piece at a time, stirring constantly. Cook and stir till thickened (1 to 2 minutes). Immediately remove from heat. If sauce is too thick or curdles, immediately beat in 1 to 2 tablespoons hot tap water.
Serve with beef, pork, or poultry. Makes 3/4 cup (twelve 1-tablespoon servings).

recipes.title: Sweet-Sour Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Perfect for spareribs, egg rolls, or fried wontons.

instructions.text: In a small saucepan combine brown sugar and cornstarch. Stir in vinegar, pineapple juice, green pepper, pimiento, soy sauce, garlic powder, and ginger.
Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more.
Serve warm with spareribs, egg rolls, or fried wontons. Makes about 1 1/4 cups (twenty 1-tablespoon servings).

notes: FAST recipe tag
Microwave directions available

recipes.title: Basic Barbecue Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Vary the hotness by adjusting the amount of hot pepper sauce.

ingredients.item: finely chopped onion or 1 tablespoon dried minced onion

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine catsup, onion, vinegar, sugar, Worcestershire sauce, celery seed, hot pepper sauce, 1/2 cup water, and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer 10 to 15 minutes or to desired consistency.
Brush on beef, pork, or poultry during the last 10 to 20 minutes of grilling or roasting. If desired, pass remaining sauce. Makes 1 1/2 cups (twenty-eight 1-tablespoon servings).

notes: Hot-Style Barbecue Sauce: Add 1 teaspoon chili powder and 1/2 teaspoon ground red pepper with the catsup
Tangy Mustard Barbecue Sauce: Omit celery seed. Add 2 tablespoons prepared mustard and 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder with the catsup

recipes.title: Tartar Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic accompaniment for fish and seafood.

ingredients.item: finely chopped sweet or dill pickle or dill pickle relish

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine mayonnaise or salad dressing, pickle, onion, parsley, pimiento, and lemon juice.
Cover and chill at least 2 hours before serving. Store in the refrigerator up to 2 weeks.
Serve with fish or seafood. Makes 1 1/4 cups (twenty 1-tablespoon servings).

notes: EASY recipe tag
Low-Fat Tartar Sauce: Substitute 1/3 cup reduced-calorie mayonnaise or salad dressing and 2/3 cup plain yogurt for the mayonnaise. Omit lemon juice.

recipes.title: Cranberry Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Fresh homemade cranberry sauce for the holidays.

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine sugar and 1 cup water. Bring to boiling, stirring to dissolve sugar. Boil rapidly for 5 minutes.
Add cranberries. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Boil gently over medium-high heat for 3 to 4 minutes or till skins pop, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat. Serve warm or chilled with beef, pork, or poultry. Makes about 2 cups (eight 1/4-cup servings).

notes: Molded Cranberry Sauce: Cook cranberry mixture for 13 to 16 minutes or till a drop gels on a cold plate. Pour into a 1 1/2-cup mold; chill till firm. Unmold.

Almond Cranberry Sauce: Substitute 1/3 cup honey for the sugar. Boil 8 minutes before adding cranberries. After removing from heat, stir in 1/4 cup apricot or peach preserves or orange marmalade and 1/4 cup toasted sliced almonds.

recipes.title: Plum Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Asian-inspired sauce for beef, lamb, pork, or poultry.

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine red plum jam, sliced green onion, and cornstarch. Add dry sherry, soy sauce, and vinegar.
Cook and stir till bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more.
Serve with beef, lamb, pork, or poultry. Makes 3/4 cup (twelve 1-tablespoon servings).

notes: FAST recipe tag
Microwave directions available

recipes.title: Steak and Burger Toppings
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Dress up steaks and burgers with one of these sauces. Each makes enough for 4 servings.
notes: Mushroom-Onion Sauce: Cook 1 cup sliced fresh mushrooms and ¼ cup sliced green onion in 2 tablespoons margarine or butter. Stir in ½ cup dairy sour cream and ¼ teaspoon pepper. Heat through; do not boil.
Sour Cream and Chive Sauce: Combine ½ cup dairy sour cream, 2 tablespoons snipped chives, 1 tablespoon prepared horseradish, and dash pepper. Chill.

Mustard-Chive Sauce: In a saucepan melt 1 tablespoon margarine or butter. Stir in 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour and ½ teaspoon salt till bubbly. Add ¾ cup milk. Cook and stir till bubbly. Remove from heat. Stir in 1 tablespoon snipped chives and 1 teaspoon Dijon-style mustard.

Parsley Pesto: In a blender container place 2 cups lightly packed chopped parsley, 2 tablespoons chopped walnuts, 1 clove garlic, quartered. Cover and blend till nearly smooth. Stir in ¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese.

recipes.title: Spaghetti Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 242
recipes.description: Classic Italian-American meat sauce for spaghetti.

instructions.text: In Dutch oven cook meat, onion, green pepper, and celery till meat is brown. Drain. Stir in undrained tomatoes, tomato sauce, tomato paste, sugar, oregano, basil, bay leaf, and garlic. Bring to boiling; reduce heat.
Cover and simmer about 30 minutes or till desired consistency. Discard bay leaf. Serve over hot pasta. Serves 6.

Microwave directions: In a 3-quart casserole combine meat, onion, green pepper, and garlic on 100% power (high) for 6 to 8 minutes or till no pink remains, stirring twice. Drain. Stir in remaining ingredients except pasta. Micro-cook, covered, on high 6 to 8 minutes or till mixture bubbles, stirring once. Discard bay leaf. Serve over pasta. Makes 6 servings.

recipes.title: Pan Gravy for Roasted Meat
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic pan gravy made from roast drippings

instructions.text: After removing roasted meat from pan, pour drippings into a large measuring cup, scraping out the crusty browned bits. Skim fat. (To skim fat, tilt measuring cup and spoon off the oily liquid that rises to the top.) Reserve 1/4 cup fat.
In a medium saucepan combine reserved fat and 1/4 cup all-purpose flour. Add enough beef broth or water to drippings in the measuring cup to equal 2 cups liquid.
Add to flour mixture. Cook and stir over medium heat till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes more.
Season to taste.

missing_inputs: Not in database: pan drippings from roast
assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for beef broth or water

recipes.title: Pan Gravy for Roasted Meat
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic pan gravy made from roast meat drippings.

instructions.text: After removing roasted meat from pan, pour drippings into a large measuring cup, scraping out the crusty browned bits. Skim fat, reserving ¼ cup fat. (To skim fat: The oily liquid that rises to the top.)
Reserve all the oily liquid and ¼ cup of reserved fat.
In a medium saucepan combine reserved fat and ¼ cup all-purpose flour. Cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes.
Add enough beef broth or water to equal 2 cups liquid. Add all at once to flour mixture. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes more. Season to taste.

notes: The browned bits from the pan add tremendous flavor

missing_inputs: Not in database: pan drippings from roast

recipes.title: Fruit Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Sweeten to taste with 1 to 2 tablespoons sugar.

ingredients.item: 8- to 8 1/2-ounce can fruit (unpeeled apricot halves, pitted light sweet cherries, fruit cocktail, peach slices, pear slices, or crushed pineapple) or one 10-ounce package frozen fruit, thawed (red raspberries, strawberries, or peach slices)

instructions.text: In a saucepan mix orange peel, orange juice, cornstarch, and cinnamon. Stir in undrained fruit. Cook and stir till bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more. Serve over ice cream, cake, cheesecake, or crepes.

notes: Lemon Sauce: Prepare as above, except substitute lemon peel for the orange peel and 1/2 cup water plus 1 tablespoon lemon juice for the orange juice. Makes 2/3 cup (4 servings).

recipes.title: Caramel Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a heavy saucepan mix sugar and cornstarch. Stir in 1/4 cup water. Stir in cream and corn syrup. Cook and stir till bubbly (mixture may appear curdled). Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Remove from heat; stir in margarine and vanilla. Serve warm or cool over ice cream, fruit, cheesecake, or cake.

recipes.title: Orange Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Tastes great with gingerbread or ice cream.

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine sugar, cornstarch, and orange peel. Stir in orange juice. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more. Remove from heat; stir in margarine or butter. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Rhubarb Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a saucepan mix sugar, water, and, if desired, 1 strip orange peel. Bring to boiling. Add rhubarb slices. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 5 minutes or till rhubarb is tender. Remove peel. Serve over cake or ice cream.

recipes.title: Vanilla Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Delicious with fresh or poached fruit.

instructions.text: In a small saucepan combine yolks, milk, and sugar. Cook and stir till mixture is thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat. Cool, then chill. To serve, whip cream and vanilla to soft peaks. Fold into yolk mixture.

recipes.title: Whiskey Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Southerners traditionally ladle this sauce over bread pudding.

instructions.text: In a small saucepan melt margarine or butter. Stir in sugar, egg yolk, and water. Cook and stir constantly over medium-low heat for 5 to 6 minutes or till sugar dissolves and mixture boils. Remove from heat and stir in bourbon. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Whipped Cream
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a chilled bowl combine whipping cream, sugar, and vanilla. Beat with chilled beaters of an electric mixer on medium speed till soft peaks form. Serve with pie, fruit desserts, cake, cream puffs, and hot drinks.

notes: Flavored Whipped Cream: Prepare as above, except add one of the following with the vanilla: 2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder plus 1 tablespoon additional sugar, 2 tablespoons amaretto or coffee, hazelnut, orange, or praline liqueur; 1 teaspoon instant coffee crystals; 1/2 teaspoon almond extract; 1/4 teaspoon finely shredded lemon, orange, or lime peel; or 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, nutmeg, or ginger.

recipes.title: Hard Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Traditionally served with steamed puddings and warm gingerbread.

instructions.text: In a small mixer bowl beat together softened margarine or butter and powdered sugar with an electric mixer on medium speed for 3 to 5 minutes or till mixture is well combined. Beat in vanilla. Spoon into serving bowl. Chill to harden. Serve with plum pudding or warm gingerbread.

notes: Brandy Hard Sauce: Prepare as above, except substitute 1 tablespoon brandy or rum for the vanilla.
Orange Hard Sauce: Prepare as above, except substitute 1/4 teaspoon finely shredded orange peel and 1 tablespoon orange juice or orange liqueur for the vanilla.

recipes.title: Herbed Sauce for Fish
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Here's an easy sauce to brush over fish during baking or broiling (see chart, page 185). In a small saucepan melt 3 tablespoons margarine or butter.

ingredients.item: dried dillweed or dried basil, rosemary, or oregano, crushed; and/or snipped parsley

instructions.text: In a small saucepan melt 3 tablespoons margarine or butter. Stir in lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon dried dillweed or dried basil, rosemary, or oregano, crushed, and/or 1 tablespoon snipped parsley, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Brush with margarine mixture. Grill for 3 to 7 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

recipes.servings_yield: Makes about 1/4 cup (enough for 1 pound of fillets)
